title: Samsung introduces SOCAMM2 LPDDR5X memory module for AI data centers
summary: Samsung has announced its SOCAMM2 LPDDR5-based memory module for AI data center platforms, offering reduced power consumption and double the bandwidth compared to DDR5 RDIMMs.

title: Here's why HBM is coming for your PC's RAM
summary: AI's appetite for high-bandwidth memory is reshaping the global DRAM and NAND market, diverting wafer capacity and advanced packaging away from consumer products and driving sharp price increases across markets.

title: LG responds swiftly to user backlash, will allow users to remove Microsoft Copilot link from TVs
summary: LG has clarified that Microsoft Copilot is not an app that can be removed, but users will be able to remove it in a future update via a tile removal option on the webOS.

title: Grab a new Elegoo 3D printer from just $149, thanks to huge holiday sale up to 53% savings on FDM and resin machines before Christmas
summary: Elegoo has slashed the prices on its 3D printers for the holidays, with up to 53% off.

title: Taiwan considers TSMC export ban that would prevent manufacturing its newest chip nodes in U.S.
summary: Taiwan's government is considering imposing an export rule on TSMC, making it harder for the foundry to develop overseas. This rule would limit exports to two generations behind leading-edge nodes, potentially slowing down U.S. expansion.

title: Prusa Research introduces the Open Community License to protect open source 3D Printing hardware   new rules aimed at addressing industry abuses
summary: Prusa Research has introduced the Open Community License for open source 3D printing hardware. The new license includes full STEP and Fusion CAD files for the CORE One+ and CORE One L. This is aimed at addressing industry abuses.

title: Helping to fight the RAM-pocalypse, this $470 Newegg combo pairs an Asus RoG Strix X870E-H WiFi 7 motherboard with 32GB of G.Skill Flare X5 Series DDR5-6000 RAM
summary: This Newegg bundle saves $119 when buying Asus's X870E-H motherboard and G.Skill DDR5-6000 32GB RAM kit together.

title: Ongoing YouTube, Google outage reported outage spikes across popular services
summary: Multiple reports indicate that YouTube, YouTube TV, and Google are all down.

title: OpenAI's Stargate data center gets approval to receive 1.4 gigawatts of power in Michigan
summary: The Michigan Public Service Commission approved a 1.4-gigawatt contract between DTE Energy and a Stargate data center, raising concerns about potential energy price spikes for local residents.

title: HP Omen 34c G2 34-inch WQHD 180 Hz gaming monitor review: Delivering style, speed and value
summary: HP brings a solid performance and value to the 34-inch ultra-wide segment with the Omen 34c G2, featuring a VA panel, WQHD resolution, and 180 Hz refresh rate.

title: Intel-certified 256 GB DDR5 stick could cut Xeon memory power by 18%, saving millions of dollars a 32W-per-socket reduction could save millions per hyperscale data center
summary: SK hynix validated a 256GB DDR5 module with Intel, resulting in up to 32.4W power savings per server, or millions of dollars per hyperscale data center.

title: China convicts 27 people for smuggling 166 tons of critical chipmaking element antimony heavily-restricted mineral used for semiconductor manufacturing exported without licenses, court decides
summary: A Chinese court sentenced 27 individuals for illegally exporting antimony ingots without licenses, with authorities saying more than 166 metric tons were smuggled earlier this year.

title: French authorities arrest man for installing malware on a passenger ferry on behalf of 'a foreign power' could have enabled external control of systems, including navigation
summary: French authorities have arrested a Latvian national suspected of installing malware aboard an Italian passenger ferry while it was docked in southern France.

title: North Korean hackers stole record $2 billion in crypto in 2025, including single heist worth $1.5 billion, report claims
summary: North Korean hackers set a record for crypto theft in 2025, stealing $2 billion including a $1.5 billion heist, and accounting for 60% of all reported crypto thefts this year.

title: Grab this  $138 2TB Acer Predator SSD before flash prices soar further   fast Gen 4 speeds make this an essential upgrade for your gaming PC
summary: Acer's 2TB Predator GM7000 SSD is an affordable option priced at £137.96 in the UK.

title: Critical motherboard flaw allows game cheats, Riot Games blocks 'Valorant' players that don't update BIOS
summary: Riot Games discovered a vulnerability in several motherboards that potentially allowed cheating DMA devices to run before protections kicked in after boot, prompting major motherboard vendors to push live security patches.

title: Windows Server 2025 gains native NVMe support, 14 years after its introduction  groundbreaking I/O stack drops SCSI emulation limitations for massive throughput and CPU efficiency gains
summary: Windows Server 2025 gets native NVMe with massive I/O and CPU gains

title: Score the Meta Quest 3S at its lowest-ever price before Christmas, now just $229 save 21% on this standalone VR headset with 128GB of storage
summary: Save $60 on the price of the Meta Quest S3 VR headset, back down to its lowest ever price, with delivery still possible before Christmas.

title: AMD's legacy Ryzen 7 5800X3D chips now sell for up to $800, more than a new 9800X3D   AM4 chip costs twice as much as MSRP, as enthusiasts flock to old DDR4 memory
summary: Demand for AMD's two-generation-old Ryzen 7 5800X3D has increased, causing second-hand prices to climb as high as $800 due to DDR5 memory price hikes.

title: Huawei's AI chip capabilities still pale in comparison to American silicon report from U.S. council details that despite fears, Nvidia continues to lead by a wide margin
summary: A new report concludes that Huawei's AI chip capabilities lag behind Nvidia's by a wide margin, and the gap is growing exponentially.

title: Mini-ITX motherboard launches with four full-sized RAM slots in the middle of a RAM shortage support for up to 256GB of glorious DDR5 on a tiny PCB
summary: Maxsun launches the MS-PC Farm B860I, a mini-ITX motherboard with four DDR5 memory slots for Intel processors.

title: Unreal Engine 5.7 brings significant improvements over the notoriously demanding 5.4 version, tester claims benchmark shows up to 25% GPU performance increase, 35% CPU boost
summary: Epic is making strides with Unreal Engine 5's development, fixing performance issues and improving visual fidelity without downsides.

title: TSMC brings its most advanced chipmaking node to the US yet, to begin equipment installation for 3mn months ahead of schedule
summary: TSMC's Arizona fab is on track for equipment move-in in mid-2026 and volume production in 2027.

title: This $379.99 MSI gaming handheld is the cheapest Steam Deck rival you can buy right now, huge saving on this Claw A1M's original price scores you rig with 1TB SSD and 16GB RAM
summary: The MSI Claw A1M handheld is now available at $379.99, making it a cheap alternative to the Steam Deck. It also includes a 1TB SSD and 16GB RAM.

title: AI surpasses 2024 Bitcoin mining in energy usage, uses more H20 than the bottles of water people drink globally, study claims   says AI demand could hit 23GW and up to 764 billion liters of water in 2025
summary: A study finds that AI has surpassed Bitcoin and the bottled water industry in its use of resources, with other experts saying that the estimate is actually conservative.

title: HyperX SoloCast 2 Review: A built-in stand that you'll want to mount
summary: The HyperX SoloCast 2 is an impressive $60 cardioid mic with a clever built-in stand, but you'll still want to mount it on a boom arm for the best results.

title: North Korean infiltrator caught working in Amazon IT department thanks to lag  110ms keystroke input raises red flags over true location
summary: A North Korean imposter was uncovered, working as a sysadmin at Amazon U.S., after their keystroke input lag raised suspicions with security specialists at the online retail giant.

title: Grab a punchy RTX 5060 Ti-powered iBuypower gaming PC for less than $900, it even packs 32GB of DDR5 RGB RAM and an 8-core Ryzen processor
summary: This $899 PC from Walmart is a smart pick ahead of Christmas, featuring 32GB of DDR5 RAM and an RTX 5060 Ti.

title: Honda to temporarily shut down factories in China and Japan because of chip shortage disruption caused by fallout from on-going conflict within Nexperia
summary: Honda suspended operations in five manufacturing plants due to a lack of legacy chips from Nexperia. The move is a result of a chip shortage. Honda is temporarily shutting down its factories in China and Japan.

title: 42-year old QuickShot II joystick gets an era-appropriate revival
summary: The QuickShot II from the Commodore 64 era is getting a modern revival, with a mix of era-appropriate design and contemporary features.

title: Samsung eyed up for huge 8nm chip order from Intel
summary: Samsung Foundry has secured a substantial order from Intel to produce Intel's chipsets on Samsung Foundry's 8nm process node.

title: China may have reverse engineered EUV lithography tool in covert lab, report claims
summary: China has reportedly built and begun testing a secret EUV lithography prototype, but it remains years away from achieving a complete production-ready manufacturing capability.

title: New Texas Instruments fab will pump out tens of millions of chips per day   first 300mm fab starts production after $60 billion investment
summary: Texas Instruments has started producing 300mm wafers at its new Sherman, Texas mega-site, capable of outputting tens of millions of chips per day.

title: $100 Steam Machine uses a cut-down PS5 APU with Bazzite DIY console offers 60 FPS at 1080p with 16GB of GDDR6
summary: A YouTuber built a '$100 Steam Machine' using a modified ASRock mining blade featuring a B-grade AMD SoC from the PS5. The PS5 chip can run games at 1080p and 60 FPS. The console has 16GB of GDDR6.

title: Micron outlines grim outlook for DRAM supply in first earnings call since killing Crucial memory and SSD brand
summary: Micron posted record revenues, but admits supply shortages will persist, with the company only able to meet half to two-thirds of demand.

title: Evidence of Intel's 'Big Battlemage' GPU continues to mount, as BMG-G31 chip gets another official confirmation
summary: Intel's 'Big Battlemage' GPU is likely to be released soon as the XPU Manager tool is used for monitoring their datacenter GPUs.

title: Sales of chip production equipment to reach $156 billion by 2027   China, Taiwan, and Korea lead intense demand
summary: Sales of chip production equipment are projected to increase through 2027, driven by demand for AI and HPC accelerators, with Asian countries leading the pack.

title: AMD's rumored Ryzen 7 9850X3D spotted at Swiss and U.S. retailers
summary: The Ryzen 7 9850X3D has been spotted at two retailers with prices suggesting it would cost between $550 to $600, which is higher than the 9800X3D's $449 MSRP.

title: Rapidus explores panel-level packaging on glass substrates for next-generation processors
summary: Rapidus plans to explore panel-level packaging using 600 600 mm glass substrates, aiming to leapfrog rivals by combining glass-core substrates and PLP for future AI and HPC chiplet packages.

title: How to choose a CPU   A guide to picking the right processor for your PC
summary: Choosing the right CPU is a crucial decision when building a PC. Consider factors such as performance, power consumption, and compatibility. With so many options available, it can be a tough choice.

title: Engineer turns E-ink tablet into computer monitor in Linux
summary: A software engineer upcycled an old E-ink tablet to create a remote secondary display using Linux, reducing eye strain and providing a bespoke reading experience.

title: Turtle Beach Vulcan II TKL review: Pretty, bright, and mechanical
summary: Turtle Beach's Vulcan II TKL is an attractive hot-swappable gaming keyboard with a slim, well-built chassis and hot-swappable linear mechanical switches.

title: Intel details progress on fabbing 2D transistors a few atoms thick in standard high volume fab production environment
summary: Intel and imec demonstrate the first 300-mm, fab-compatible integration of contacts and gate stacks for 2D transistors, marking a critical step towards turning 2D materials into a future option for high-volume logic manufacturing.

title: Corsair MP700 Pro XT 2TB SSD review: the fastest SSD ever has landed with a record 3.3 million IOPS and nearly 15 GB/s
summary: The Corsair MP700 Pro XT is a true high-end SSD contender, delivering solid numbers across the board.

title: Intel installs industry's first commercial High-NA EUV lithography tool
summary: Intel has installed ASML's TWINSCAN EXE:5200B, the first High-NA EUV lithography tool for commercial production, setting the stage for 14A process technology.

title: Score an RTX 5080 and 9800X3D pre-built for under  2,300 with this CyberPowerPC deal   save  200 on this 4K gaming PC with 32GB RAM and 1TB SSD
summary: The price of a CyberPowerPC gaming rig has been reduced to £2,299, featuring an AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D and Nvidia GeForce RTX 5080.

title: These 16 gadgets under $100 are must-haves for hobbyists and PC builders
summary: Get budget-friendly tech gifts for the tech-savvy with screwdrivers, M.2 SSD enclosures, and more, ready to wrap up and share.

title: Newegg's triple component combo deal for $459
summary: Newegg offers a bundle deal for $459, which includes an Asus X870 motherboard, 32GB of DDR5-6000 RAM, and a 240mm AIO cooler, worth $780 individually.

title: Kioxia's next-gen 3D NAND production gets expedited to 2026, report claims high-capacity 332-layer BiCS10 devices to sate growing demand from AI data centers
summary: Kioxia is reportedly accelerating the mass production of high-capacity BiCS10 3D NAND devices with a 4.8 GT/s interface from 2027 to 2026 to meet growing demand from AI, cloud, and enterprise storage sectors.

title: Anycubic s  Dual  Resin Printer, Photon P1 is out  Supports double the color, double the material
summary: The P1 is the latest addition to Anycubic's Photon lineup, supporting double the color and material compared to its predecessors.

title: Fanless Box PC features Intel Core Ultra 5/7/9  Arrow Lake  CPU with up to 36 TOPS for Edge AI applications
summary: AAEON BOXER-6648-ARS is a fanless embedded box PC with Intel Core Ultra 5/7/9 Arrow Lake CPU, up to 24 cores, 36 TOPS AI performance, and 35W or 65W TDP.

title: ESP32-P4 learning and prototyping kit features 7-inch touchscreen, comes with 16 modules and AI lessons
summary: The ESP32-P4 All-in-One Starter Kit is an open-source learning and prototyping platform based on the ESP32-P4 processor, offering AI, multimedia, and embedded features. It integrates a 7-inch touchscreen display, 2MP camera, and 16 built-in modules. Development is done in C using Espressif's ESP-IDF framework.

title: Raspberry Pi RP2350 devkit features 1.85-inch round touch display, microphone, optional speaker and battery box
summary: The Waveshare RP2350-Touch-LCD-1.85C is a Raspberry Pi RP2350 devkit with a 1.85-inch round touchscreen display and a built-in microphone. It also comes with optional speaker and battery box. The devkit can be used for HMI solutions with various input and output options.

title: LILYGO T-Echo Plus off-grid LoRa communicator features a climbing hook for hiking, cycling, and remote communication
summary: The LILYGO T-Echo Plus is an off-grid LoRa communicator with a built-in climbing hook, supporting Bluetooth, Thread, Zigbee, and LoRa transceiver, with additional features like a 1.54-inch display and a 2400mAh battery.

title: REETLE SmartInk I   An AI-powered E-Ink phone case with voice recording (Crowdfunding)
summary: The REETLE SmartInk I is a phone case with a touch-enabled E-Ink display and AI features, featuring a secondary screen for reading, recording voice, and displaying tasks. It has a 3.97-inch E-Ink touchscreen, AI-based transcription, and smart to-do display, synced to a companion mobile app via Bluetooth 5.0. It supports various phones and has military-grade drop protection.

title: NASP NeuroVoice VAD chip enables always-on voice activity detection at microwatt-level power consumption
summary: The POLYN Technology NASP NeuroVoice VAD chip is an ultra-low-power chip that detects voice in any noisy background at microwatt-level power consumption and microsecond-scale latency. It has various features such as voice passthrough, wake word detection, and audio interfaces. Potential applications include smart remote controls, earbuds, and IoT devices.

title: Radxa Dragon Q6A Arm SBC gets official Windows 11 preview
summary: Radxa has announced official Windows support for the Radxa Dragon Q6A Arm SBC, which comes with a Windows 11 preview image. The preview includes HDMI output, PCIe, NVMe storage, and USB support. However, network card drivers are not included.

title: Toradex Luna SL1680 A Pro Consumer Raspberry Pi lookalike based on Synaptics SL1680 Edge AI SoC
summary: Toradex Luna SL1680 is a credit card-sized single board computer with a Synaptics SL1680 quad-core Cortex-A73 SoC, built-in 7.9 TOPS NPU, and designed for pro consumer and light industrial Edge AI applications.

title: Fusion HAT+ Raspberry Pi expansion board targets motor and servo control with AI and LLMs
summary: The SunFounder Fusion HAT+ is a Raspberry Pi expansion board designed for motor and servo control with AI and LLMs, featuring 4 DC motor drivers, 12 PWM servo channels, and interfaces for sensors and voice interaction.

title: Compact development board features a single ESP32-P4 + ESP32-C5 dual-band Wi-Fi 6 module, MIPI display and camera interfaces
summary: The Wireless Tag WTDKP4C5-S1 is a compact development board that combines the ESP32-P4 with an ESP32-C5 dual-band Wi-Fi 6 module, supporting MIPI display and camera interfaces. It also provides dual-band Wi-Fi 6, BLE 5, Zigbee, Thread, and Matter connectivity. The board is suited for various applications such as LVGL-based HMIs, data acquisition, and Edge AI.

title: Maxell PSB2032 35 mAh all-solid-state coin cell battery targets industrial IoT devices
summary: Maxell's PSB2032 is a rechargeable all-solid-state coin cell battery for industrial IoT devices with a 35mAh capacity, delivering key benefits of solid-state batteries such as high reliability, safety, and a wide discharge temperature range.

title: MicroPython v1.27 adds support for ESP32-C5, ESP32-P4, and STM32U5 microcontrollers
summary: MicroPython v1.27 adds support for ESP32-C5, ESP32-P4, and STM32U5 microcontrollers, along with various other changes and improvements.

title: HealthyPi 6  A portable Wi-Fi 6 biosignal acquisition device with ECG, PPG, respiration, and temperature sensors (Crowdfunding)
summary: The HealthyPi 6 is a portable, open-source biosignal acquisition device with ECG, PPG, respiration, and temperature sensors, suitable for academic research, education, and prototyping.

title: VEGA AS2161 DHRUV64    A 1GHz dual-core 64-bit RISC-V microprocessor designed in India
summary: The Indian government has developed the DHRUV64 (VEGA AS2161), a 1GHz dual-core 64-bit RISC-V microprocessor, with the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) under the Microprocessor Development Programme (MDP). The processor supports Linux and has advanced features such as a 13-16 stage out-of-order pipeline implementation. This is part of India's efforts to spur its semiconductor design and manufacturing industry.

title: Luckfox Aura  A Raspberry Pi-like Linux SBC powered by Rockchip RV1126B SoC with 3 TOPS NPU
summary: The Luckfox Aura is a compact Linux SBC with Rockchip's RV1126B quad-core Arm Cortex-A53 processor, 3 TOPS NPU, and AI vision, multimedia processing, and edge computing capabilities.

title: The ESP Private Agents platform aims to ease the development of ESP32-based AI voice assistants with on-device processing
summary: Espressif has introduced the ESP Private Agents platform to help developers build local AI assistants for ESP32 devices with on-device processing. It offers a unified framework for building applications combining speed, vision, automation, and agent-based interactions. The platform supports hybrid AI workloads and works with ESP32 devices, mobile apps, and web clients.

title: tinySA is a low-cost handheld spectrum analyzer with built-in signal generator
summary: The tinySA is a compact, low-cost handheld spectrum analyzer and RF signal generator. It comes in three variants and can be used for various RF-related tasks. The devices support frequency ranges up to 12GHz and have USB-C charging and PC control.

title: Calixto Systems SL1680 OPTIMA industrial SoM and EVK features Synaptics SL1680 Edge AI processor
summary: Calixto Systems has introduced the SL1680 OPTIMA industrial SoM with a Synaptics SL1680 quad-core Arm Cortex-A73 SoC and an evaluation kit (EVK) for Edge AI and advanced multimedia applications.

title: reTerminal E1001/E1002 Review  B&W and color ePaper displays tested with SenseCraft HMI and Home Assistant
summary: Seeed Studio's reTerminal E1001 (monochrome) and E1002 (color) ePaper displays are powered by an ESP32-S3 microcontroller, suitable for low-power information display applications, and can last up to 3 months on a single charge.

title: Luxonis OAK4 standalone AI vision camera features Qualcomm QCS8550 SoC with up to 52 TOPS performance
summary: Luxonis OAK 4 is a standalone AI vision system/camera that offers up to 52 TOPS of AI performance with a 48 MP RGB camera sensor and various models with depth sensing capabilities.

title: UP Xtreme ARL AI Dev Kit review: Benchmarks and AI workloads on an Intel Core Ultra 5 225H Arrow Lake SBC
summary: The reviewer tested the high-end UP Xtreme ARL AI Dev Kit with a 14-core Intel Core Ultra 5 225H Arrow Lake single board computer, running Ubuntu 24.04 Pro and delivering up to 83 TOPS of AI performance. They ran benchmarks and AI workloads using Nx Meta and the AAEON UP AI Toolkit system. This was their first experience with the Intel Arrow Lake platform.

title: CIX releases P1 CPU TRM and developer guides for GPU, AI accelerator, OS and firmware/BIOS
summary: CIX has released the technical reference manual for the P1 Arm Cortex-A720/A520 SoC, along with developer guides for GPU, AI accelerator, OS, and firmware/BIOS. The P1 processor was introduced on the Radxa Orion O6 mini-ITX motherboard with performance similar to Apple M1 SoC and Qualcomm 8cx Gen3 platform at an affordable price. This marks a slow but steady progress in the native open source ecosystem chip.

title: Diptyx E-Reader An open-source, ESP32-powered, dual-screen e-book reader (Crowdfunding)
summary: The Diptyx E-Reader is an open-source, dual-screen e-book reader powered by an ESP32-S3 wireless module, featuring automatic standby mode and e-ink displays for weeks-long battery life.

title: Renesas RA6W1/RA6W2 Cortex-M33 wireless MCUs offer dual-band Wi-Fi 6, BLE, Matter, 15-year availability
summary: Renesas has added two new MCUs to its RA6 family with dual-band Wi-Fi 6, Bluetooth LE, and Matter connectivity, featuring a 160 MHz Arm Cortex-M33 core and various peripherals.

title: nRF9151 SMA DK development kit offers cellular IoT, DECT NR+, and 5G NTN satellite connectivity
summary: The nRF9151 SMA DK development kit is designed for building IoT applications with LTE-M/NB-IoT cellular IoT, DECT NR+, or 5G NTN satellite connectivity. It includes features like a NanoSIM card slot, multiple current measurement connectors, and Arduino UNO headers for expansion. The kit supports 700-2200 MHz LTE band and 1.9 GHz and 915 Mhz DECT NR+ bands.

title: UP Squared Pro TWL AI Dev Kit Review Intel N150 + Hailo-8L accelerator tested on Ubuntu 24.04
summary: The reviewer tested the UP Squared Pro TWL AI devkit with an Intel N150 CPU and a 13 TOPS Hailo-8L M.2 AI accelerator, running Ubuntu 24.04 Pro. They found that the 64GB eMMC storage was tight, so they installed an NVMe SSD to expand storage. The reviewer plans to run benchmarks and test AI workloads.

title: Up to 16-core AMD EPYC Embedded 2005 Series Zen 5 processors support up 28 PCIe Gen5 lanes, offer 10-year availability
summary: AMD has introduced the EPYC Embedded 2005 Series, mid-range processors featuring up to 16 cores, 28 PCIe Gen5 lanes, and 10-year availability for space-constrained networking, storage, and industrial edge applications.

title: iWave Systems iG-RainboW-G69M TI AM62L OSM Size-S system-on-module powers Raspberry Pi-sized SBC
summary: The iWave Systems iG-RainboW-G69M is a 30x30mm CPU module based on the Texas Instruments AM62L dual-core Cortex-A53 SoC for low-power IoT and HMI applications.

title: IoT HDMI switch An ESP32-C3-powered 2-source HDMI switch automated with Home Assistant
summary: The IoT HDMI Switch is an ESP32-C3-based open-source HDMI switch that automates up to two HDMI inputs for TVs, monitors, or projectors with Home Assistant and ESPHome integration.

title: AMD Ryzen Embedded 8840U COM Express Type 6 Compact module takes up to 128GB DDR5
summary: SolidRun has unveiled a new COM Express Type 6 Compact module powered by the AMD Ryzen Embedded 8840U Series with up to 39 TOPS of AI performance. It supports up to 128GB DDR5 of memory and features an Intel i226 2.5GbE controller. The module is ideal for industrial, medical, automation, and edge AI applications.

title: STEVAL-ROBKIT1 A robot evaluation kit based on STM32H725 and STM32G0 microcontrollers
summary: The STEVAL-ROBKIT1 is an evaluation kit for robotics applications based on ST's STM32H725 and STM32G0 Arm microcontrollers. It features an STM32H725 main board, an STM32G0 motor-control PCB, and a robotic frame, wheels, and motors with encoders. No soldering is required for assembly.

title: 52Pi UPS Gen 6 UPS for Raspberry Pi 4/5 supports up to 4x external battery packs, PikaPython scripting
summary: The 52Pi UPS Gen 6 is a UPS solution for Raspberry Pi 4/5 with external battery packs, I2C, and PikaPython scripting for power management and safe shutdowns. It features a physical power button, 12V power interface, and switching hardware for bumpless power transfer. The board also includes an aluminum heatsink with an automatic fan for cooling.
